title: US aerospace developer acquires Uber’s air taxi enterprise
lead: The company plans to offer an affordable, quiet and clean transportation solution using an electric jet with a range of up to 150 miles and a top speed of 200mph

title: Recycled wind turbine blades can help clean up cement production – but how?
lead: GE Renewable Energy says ground-up turbine blades could replace raw materials such as coal, sand and clay in cement manufacturing facilities across the US

title: EDF launches ‘cheapest ever’ tariff for EV drivers
lead: The zero carbon renewable ‘GoElectric 35 tariff’ offers the cheapest off-peak rate on the market at just 4.5p/kWh

title: Scotland awards £18m to support sustainable farming
lead: Letters with grant offers have been sent to more than 3,500 eligible farmers and crofters towards the purchase of agricultural equipment chosen for its effectiveness in reducing greenhouse gases

title: Siemens Gamesa secures €300m loan from EU bank
lead: It will support work mainly at Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy’s research and development centres in Spain and Denmark

title: Short term energy price risk from Brexit related currency fluctuations
lead: The market has responded to a lack of renewable wind generation across the region, and Brexit concerns expose a short-term risk. What do these issues mean for energy buyers?

title: Italy’s Eni buys 20% stake in world’s largest offshore wind project
lead: With the acquisition, Eni adds 480MW of green energy to its 2025 target of 5GW of installed capacity from renewable sources

title: Rolls-Royce agrees to sell civil nuclear I&C business to Framatome
lead: It includes Rolls-Royce’s activities and teams based in France, the Czech Republic and China but excludes its civil nuclear business or small modular reactor activities in the UK

title: Opus Energy is sponsoring Most Trusted Supplier (Small) at TELCA 2020 – and here’s the shortlist…
lead: This year, our industry-recognised awards show is taking place online on the 11th of December

title: First green number plates for clean vehicles hit UK roads
lead: The green number plates will help drivers benefit from local initiatives such as cheaper parking and cost-free entry into zero-emission zones
